brief_summary.textblock: Investing the Timed Up and Go (TUG) Test in Hemiplegic Patients Using 3D Motion Analysis

clinical_study.brief_title: Time Up and go in Hemiplegic Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
The timed up and go is a routine  quick test assessing motor functional tasks including
      stand up ,walk 3 m,turn around and sitting down.We will included hemiplegic patients to
      quantify biomechanic parameters

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients performing 3D gait analysis

          -  Male or female adults aged ≥ 18 years,

          -  Hemiplegia following unique stroke- Patients with hemiplegia able to stand up
             alone,walk and turn around alone without  assistance.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient with a protective measure,

          -  Pregnant women, breastfeeding

          -  Brain damage bilateral cerebellar syndrome, apraxia and / or severe aphasia,

          -  Patient who received botulinum toxin injection in the 3 months prior to inclusion,
             patients who underwent surgery of the locomotor system in the 6 months prior to
             inclusion,

          -  No affiliation to a social security

          -  other pathology, complications with significant impact on the activities of walking.

intervention.other_name: The TUG test included stand up ,walk,turn around ,sit down

clinical_study.official_title: Quantification of Biomechanical Parameters of Functional Task Time Up and Go in Hemiplegic Patients

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

primary_outcome.description: subjects will perform the TUG test with 3D walk analysis equipment
primary_outcome.measure: Variability of the  center of mass

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
